title: Academic Projects
text:
“HokieEats” Food Delivery Service:
I was tasked with creating a database-driven “review management” module for a fictional food delivery service website and integrating it with other team member’s sections of the project. I created 9 webpages using HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, D3.js, Ajax, JavaScript, and Bootstrap, all focused on user review creation, modification, and analysis.
Languages: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Bootstrap, J3.DS, Ajax

Code
View this project on Github

title: About Me
text:
About Me
I graduated from Virginia Tech’s Pamplin College of Business in May 2022 with two degrees in Business Information Technology and Finance, and a minor in Economics. Immediately after graduation, I worked in McLean, VA as a Federal Technology Risk Management Associate on a variety of IT audit readiness; segregation of dutie;, identity credentialing, and access management (ICAM); and inventory management projects at KPMG for two years.
Starting in August 2024, I began to pursue a Masters in Data Science and Analytics at Georgetown. In this program, I aim to further explore concepts in machine learning, database management, statistics, and natural language processing (NLP).


Education


Georgetown University - 2026

Masters in Data Science & Analytics



Virginia Tech - 2022

Bachelors of Science in Business Information Technology (BIT)
Bachelors of Science in Finance
Economics Minor





Work Experience

KPMG
Federal Technology Risk Management Associate
July 2022 - July 2024
1st Engagement: As a Technology Risk Management (TRM) Associate, I was responsible for researching the current-state of the DoD federal agency I was under contract for, recommending potential IT governance structure solutions, and establishing an SoD framework. This engagement resulted in the creation of an SoD governance document that was accepted by the agency.
2nd Engagement: I was responsible for supporting a DoD federal agency with their IT audit-readiness goals for fiscal year 2023. While physically visiting client sites across the United States, I walked through and tested the entirety of each site’s SAP IT system controls to identify inter-site discrepancies, system errors, and internal control gaps. In addition to on-site control testing, I assisted in the creation of an end-to-end(E2E) process control document, which documented all known controls and control gaps.
3rd Engagement: My third engagement at KPMG involved supporting a DoD government agency with the completion of corrective action plan (CAP) downgrade package for SoD and ICAM notices of findings and recommendation (NFRs). This CAP downgrade package consisted of an E2E document, control gap analysis, posting logic assessment, risk and control matrix, and responsibility-accountability matrix.
4th Engagment: During my last engagement at KPMG, I assisted in the creation of a program governance charter, current-state SoD/ICAM assessment, and Microsoft PowerBI monitoring dashboard for a specific DoD’s agency’s enterprise-wide SoD and ICAM implementation effort. In addition, I was responsible for the maintenance and submission of monthly status reports and bi-weekly activity reports.
Miscellaneous:

Living Green and API Business Resource Groups
KPMG Culture Catalyst
KPMG Health Equity Hackathon - 3rd Place



TIC Summer Camp
Python Programming Counseler
June 2021 - August 2021
As a programming counselor, I was responsible for instructing campers aged 6-11 in Scratch, and campers aged 12-18 in Python. I used the built-in python platform within Processing 3 to teach middle and high school students the basics of programming (variables, syntax, for loops, while loops, functions, classes) so that they could ultimately build their own game by the end of each two-week camp session.

title: Personal Projects
text:
Soccer League Data API
A program that accesses football-data.org’s soccer API to retrieve the current standings of Europe’s top 5 soccer leagues. It will prompt the user to select which league they want to view, and has validation rules for inputs outside of the given league list. Once a list is chosen, the program accesses the API to display that league’s current standings and offers an additional lookup.
Languages: Python

Code
View this project on Github
Download the code file



 Spotify Top Tracks:
Utilizing Spotipy and Spotify’s API to retrieve song/artist data from an inputted Spotify account, this python program returns the selected user’s top 25 tracks and artists within 3 different time periods: 4 weeks, 6 months, and all-time. Users must create an account on Spotify for Developers to obtain an API key.
Languages: Python
